diff_hunk:
@@ -668,6 +669,24 @@ def f(x, y):
         y = torch.randn(4, 4, dtype=torch.float, device='cuda')
 
         ge = self.checkTrace(f, (x, y))

+
+    @unittest.skipIf(IS_WINDOWS, "NYI: fuser support for Windows")
+    @unittest.skipIf(not RUN_CUDA, "fuser requires CUDA")
+    @skipIfRocm
+    def test_comparison_eq_ne(self):
+        def f(x, y):
+            mask = (x == 0).type_as(x)
+            z = x * mask + y
+            mask = (x != 0).type_as(x)
+            z = z * mask + y
+            return z
+
+        x = torch.randn(4, 4, dtype=torch.float, device='cuda')
+        y = torch.randn(4, 4, dtype=torch.float, device='cuda')
+
+        ge = self.checkTrace(f, (x, y))
+        self.assertExpectedGraph(ge.graph_for(x,y))
body: Well those nodes aren't even used, so they could be easily eliminated with our DCE pass. I agree that internal documentation is definitely not our string side, but all other functions that are needed to implement this have been available for a few months at least.
